current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to clarify that products derived from tar sands are
			 crude oil for purposes of the Federal excise tax on petroleum, and for
			 other purposes.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Tar Sands Tax Loophole Elimination
			 Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Tar Sands Tax Loophole Elimination Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Clarification of tar
			 sands as crude oil for excise tax purposes

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended to read as
			 follows:

external-xref.#tail: of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986

term.#tail:
includes crude oil condensates, natural gasoline, any bitumen or bituminous mixture, any oil
			 derived from a bitumen or bituminous mixture (including oil derived from
			 tar sands), and any oil derived from kerogen-bearing sources (including
			 oil derived from oil shale).

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by adding at the end the following new
			 paragraph:
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Subsection (a) of section 4612 of such Code

header.#text: Regulatory Authority To Address Other Types of Crude Oil and Petroleum Products
Regulatory Authority To Address Other Types of Crude Oil and Petroleum Products

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may prescribe, after consultation with the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Administrator of
			 the Environmental Protection Agency

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may include as crude
			 oil or as a petroleum product subject to tax under

, any fuel
			 feedstock or finished fuel product customarily transported by pipeline,
			 vessel, railcar, or tanker truck if the

text.#text:
the classification of such fuel feedstock or finished fuel product is consistent with the
			 definition of oil under the

such fuel feedstock or finished fuel product is produced in sufficient commercial quantities as to
			 pose a significant risk of hazard in the event of a discharge.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Paragraph (2) of section 4612(a) of such Code

text.#text:
The amendments made by this section shall take effect on the
			 date of the enactment of this Act.
